de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.application.filesharing
Class FileSharingClient

java.lang.Object
  de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.application.AbstractApplication
      de.tud.kom.p2psim.impl.application.filesharing.FileSharingClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
Application, Component, OperationCallback, SupportOperations
public class FileSharingClient
extends AbstractApplication

Client for a napster-like application able to advertise shared documents in any DHT-like overlay. The functionality provided to the user includes:

  • store document
  • download document

Version:
3.0, 10.12.2007
Author:
Konstantin Pussep, Sebastian Kaune

Method Detail

downloadDocument

public int downloadDocument(OverlayKey key,
                            OperationCallback callback)
Download a document using the given OverlayKey, i.e. the underlying DHTNode will be used to find a torrent for this document and then the document will be downloaded from one of the holders by using the underlying DistributionStrategy. The downloaded document will be stored in the local host's content storage.

Parameters:
key - - key of document to download
callback - - callback which will receive the operation result, i.e. the document, or a failure
Returns:
operation id

storeDocument

public int storeDocument(Document doc,
                         OperationCallback callback)
Store the document locally and announce its presence in the underlying DHT.

Parameters:
doc - - the document to store in the network
callback - - callback which will receive the operation result, i.e. which is either ok (=null) or a failure
Returns:
operation id

createOperation

@Deprecated
public AbstractOperation createOperation(java.lang.String opName,
                                                    java.lang.String[] params,
                                                    OperationCallback callback)
Deprecated. 

Description copied from interface: SupportOperations
Create an appropriate Operation. The component checks whether it can create an operation with the given name and number of parameters. This method is used only to specify operations via configuration (action) files.

Parameters:
opName - - operation name
params - - operation parameters if required.
callback - - caller Object which will be informed when the operation finishes (successfully or with a failure)
Returns:
operation - created (can be scheduled or executed immediately)
